text: (upbeat music)
- My name is Kayla Jing.
I'm a solutions architect at AWS,
and I've been here for three years.

I started from the military
apprenticeship program.

At that time, I just
graduate from college.
The military apprenticeship program

is a program that help
the military community,
both the veterans and their spouse

to transit to a career in
the cloud computing area.

We get paid training coupled
with the on-the-job training.
It helps us to gain all the skills.

And then I start to
working with a customer,

and I actually use what I
learned to help more people.
AWS is definitely a great place to work.

You can find people with
different background here.

For me, I'm a Asian and I'm
a veteran and I'm a woman.

And I can find people with
the same background as me
in my team at AWS.
I can share my experience with others,

and everybody here is welcome
and they are friendly.
If you have any questions,
you can just turn to pretty much anybody,
and then they will offer help.
Don't be afraid to try.
Start with talking to different people
and start trying to find resources.
We have lots of free resources online,
whether you want to take a class
or join some fun activities,
like we have lots of free events.

Just participate and then have
a taste to see what you like.
And if you like, just apply for a job.
Join us.
(upbeat music)
